It appears that nothing has changed after over a year. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb13', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb13', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

This was a brilliant idea, 10 things Congress should do but won't. And I read this and I am saying why wouldn't they, especially in light of everything that I just laid out that the president is doing, troops to the border, is he helping on healthcare, is he going to go back to the omnibus bill. You know, everything -- he's doing what he can on his own. Why doesn't -- why don't the Republicans want to do these things?

utterances.speaker: JASON CHAFFETZ, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: Donald Trump wants to play offense. I can tell you, having left Congress about two weeks after, there is a whole new clarity that settles down on you. And until Republicans, who have been given the mantel of power, they were elected and put into office to get things done, until they actually play offense, guess what, they're just going to be on the receiving end of attacks.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: See, if they would too these simple things, if they would fully fund the border wall and begin the construction, the money is there -- and I still think the president can get it from the DOD. If they would repeal Obamacare, like they said they would, and the president has a great idea with the associations, why do I believe that's good politics and everybody is worried about the blue wave in 2018? That would mitigate the blue wave.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: Just do what you say you're going to do. If they would just do that, and do it in proactive way -- Jim Jordan talks a lot about this. This is what the American people elected us to do. So, let's try it and see what happens. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb14', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb14', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Let me ask -- this is how I see it. I see Hillary Clinton, she fixed the primary. Maybe I'm the only personal in the world that cares about Bernie Sanders supporters. That's kind of corrupt.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY

Then she takes hammers or has people taking hammers and busting up these devices. Then, the fix is in with Strzok, Comey, Page, McCabe, and Loretta Lynch and the tarmac meeting. And they didn't interview -- writing an exoneration months before the investigation, they interview her. Two days later, they exonerate her.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And then you have the whole dossier and then you have lying to FISA court judges.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: And you have to understand that Director Comey went to President-elect Trump and said, hey, there is in dossier. It's unverified. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb15', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb15', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: HANNITY

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Three months earlier.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: -- and presenting it to the court. So, why was it good enough to present to the court, but now that there is a President-elect Trump and a President Trump coming into office, suddenly, he is making excuses for it. That is something that both sides of the aisle should be looking at.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Is that a crime? In other words, I've got to believe that James Comey is in a heap of trouble between leaking this information that he had -- that was supposed to be confidential and privileged with the president. Then, of course, what he did with the special counsel appointed. Then, he's got this issue. Then, he's morphed into exonerate Hillary and he lays out 13.5 minute case and says never mind. I think he is in trouble legally. Do you? if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb16', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb16', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: Oh, I do think he is. Look, he had John Radcliffe in the House Judiciary Committee point blank, when did you make this decision, only to find out later, months later, the revelation that they started writing this exoneration months before Director Comey actually stood up in July of 2016 and said, you know, we don't find anything there there. I think he is in deep legal problems. That's why you need a second special counsel because the FBI cannot investigate itself.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Have you ever seen such corruption?

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: I haven't and it scares me, because it's at the highest levels. There is 110,000 people at the Department of Justice and they're good, hard working patriotic people.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: By the way, same with the FBI.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: This is not rank and file FBI or rank and file intelligence people. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb17', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb17', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: But you got the head of the beast here. And, you know, you look at those people in the senior most position. And that's different in electronic age now we have text messages and emails. Remember when the FBI said they couldn't find five months' worth with the inspector general --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: If I did what Hillary Clinton did with their emails --

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: Oh, you had handcuffs on, you'd be in jail.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You wouldn't be able to get me out.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: No, no.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Gee, thanks a lot. I'd take a cake with a file. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb18', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb18', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } But I look at all of this, did you ever heard of an FBI director taking a case away from a field office, putting it in a special category and writing an exoneration months before you investigate or talk to the key witnesses in the case?

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: And then you combine that with the people and what's going on with Robert Mueller now? One of the things I put on my list of 10 is that they should actually bring up and they should have Director Mueller and Rod Rosenstein testify before the House --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Do you think Rod Rosenstein belongs in his position?

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: I think he should be brought before Congress and he should have to testify about the conflicts of interest. And that would illuminate a whole set of problems.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. Great job to fill in for Laura. But I told you not to get -- Laura is back on Monday.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: She is. She's wonderful. She's one of the best.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I know. That was more for the liberal media. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb19', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb19', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } Congressman, good to see you.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I appreciate it.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. When we come back, you're definitely going to want to hear from U.S. Attorney Joe diGenova and esteemed legal scholar, Professor Alan Dershowitz. We have a lot of news we're getting to tonight right here on 'Hannity.' Stay with us.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Joining us now with more reaction to opening monologue, the author of the bestselling book, 'Trumped Up: How Criminalization and Political Differences Endangers Democracy', Professor Alan Dershowitz, and former U.S. attorney for the District of Columbia, Joe diGenova -- two of the smartest lawyers in the country. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb20', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb20', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } You know, last night, I got such incredible reaction to your comments. Collusion is not a crime. But we go from collusion to obstruction to then bank records. He is not a target. But the media is like, well, he's not a target but he's still in jeopardy. It's like there is no winning here.

utterances.speaker: ALAN DERSHOWITZ, HARVARD LAW SCHOOL PROFESSOR
utterances.sentences: I have to tell you, if after a year of very thorough investigation and going after all the low- hanging fruit and getting people not only to sing but some of them even perhaps to compose, if they couldn't have shifted him from a subject to a target, there's nothing there.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: What are they, hoping?

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.sentences: Of course, they are hoping. But I think they understand that. Now, they are going into very, very weak issues, collusion. I challenge Mueller to tell me what statute is violated by collusion. There's a memo now by Rosenstein authorizing him to investigate collusion with the Russians by Manafort. But you can't investigate sins. You can only investigate federal crimes. And there is no such federal crime collusion.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: How do they not know that? if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb21', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb21', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.sentences: They know it, but they hope that by investigating collusion, they'll get somebody to obstruct justice, to commit perjury, to commit one of these other peripheral crimes, as they always say it's in the cover-up. But it's not the cover-up. It's that prosecutors induce cover-ups, which is why innocent people shouldn't be testifying unless they absolutely have to because you can be indicted for perjury even if you tell the truth. If you say something that somebody else says differently.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: That's a spectacular statement. You could be indicted for perjury even if you tell the truth.

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.sentences: That's right, because if somebody contradicts you, and the prosecutor believes the person contradicting you, you are indicted for perjury even though you told the truth.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I'm going to get back to that question in just a second. Let me go to Joe diGenova. Joe, Rod Rosenstein issues this letter to Mueller, allowing him to go after Paul Manafort the way he did, a week after they did the raid. Now, why do I think the order of that legally needs to be reversed?

utterances.speaker: JOE DIGENOVA, FORMER U.S. ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: Well, let's say, this first of all, about Rod Rosenstein -- his conduct from the beginning of this has been a disgrace legally and every other way. He is an embarrassment to the administration. It is truly too bad that he cannot be fired. But let's be very clear about this. The president has never been a target. The fact that he has been recently notified that he is the subject means absolutely nothing. He is not even a subject. He is a witness. A subject is a person hesitate conduct is within the scope of the grand jury's investigation. What the hell does that mean? It means they don't have anything on him. There have been 19 criminal cases. Not one piece of evidence against the president of the United States. And now, we are told that Mueller wants to interview the president of the United States who knows nothing, who has been a witness to nothing, who is not a target of the investigation. What we are seeing now is conduct by two public officials, Robert Mueller and Rod Rosenstein that is unethical, unprofessional, an embarrassment to the United States government and is undermining equal enforcement of the law --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Oh, there's no doubt.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.sentences: -- because of what they are doing to a president of the United States. Rod Rosenstein single-handedly has taken away from the sitting president of the United States 16 months of his presidency by his incompetence and fearful conduct. You know why Rod Rosenstein appointed Mueller? Because he didn't want to make the tough decisions you would have to make if you were supervising a case being run by a United States attorney like Huber. Rod Rosenstein is a coward. He is a disgrace to the Department of Justice. It's a shame --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And you can't fire him.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.sentences: -- that the president cannot fire him because of the political consequences.

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.sentences: They can't fire him, but it's amazing that he hasn't been recused. After all, he is the main witness --

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.sentences: -- on whether or not collusion or whether or not -- I'm sorry, whether or not obstruction of justice occurred with the firing of Comey. And he wrote the memo.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: So doesn't the president have absolute right to fire anybody?

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.sentences: He does. But you know, politically there is a difference being have the right to do it and it being right to do it. I just want to comment on one thing that Joe has said. He is absolutely right that they have deprived the right of the president of the opportunity to govern but the Republicans did the same thing to Clinton. When they impeached him they knew they were never going to get him--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: We still six years into his presidency.

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.sentences: Well, but still, they made a mistake and I think they paid a heavy consequence for it I think the Democrats would pay a heavy cost if they made the same mistake. Trying to impeach without being able to remove.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I want to ask--

utterances.speaker: JOE DIGENOVA, FORMER U.S. ATTORNEY FOR THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA
utterances.sentences: By the way, I want to say something about this notion that Mueller wants to question the president. What does he want to question him about?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. This is my question, though, Joe.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.sentences: First of all, he cannot question him about the firing of Comey. That is an article two constitutional authority.

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.sentences: Absolutely. I agree.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.sentences: That the president has to fire Comey. He had every right to fire Flynn. Suppose they say what were you thinking when you fired Comey? What were you thinking when you fired Flynn?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: What kind of question is that? Well, by the way--

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.sentences: These are the kind of stupid questions that could be asked.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Let me throw out this question to both of you and--

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.sentences: This is a perjury trap. Plain and simple.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I agree with the perjury.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.sentences: This is nonsense.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You're right.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.sentences: This is absolutely outrageous, it should end right now.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Here's the question I have, because I'm sure Robert Mueller does want to question the president. So, professor?

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I would advise him not to. I'm not -- I don't have your experience. But to me, it's a trap.

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.sentences: Here's the problem. Here's the problem.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.sentences: Written questions. Written questions.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Joe, one second. Hang on, professor.

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.sentences: Here's the problem. The special counsel has the power to put him in front of a grand jury without a lawyer. So he has some leverage. What I would suggest and the president should -- might consider this is if he is asked a question why did you fire Comey, his answer is you're not allowed to ask me or question any article 2 decision I make. Just like you can't question senators to their vote, you can't question justices for their vote. If I acted within the authority of article 2, I cannot be compelled or asked why I did something.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Would you advise this president to say no to any interview?

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.sentences: I'm not advising the president.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: No, you are not. Would you advise the president?

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.sentences: I would suggest that it would be best if the president refused to answer certain questions that intruded on his article two powers.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Last word, Joe, same question.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.sentences: The president should not agree to an interview in my opinion. And I'm not giving him legal advice. I'm talking on this show. The president should act the most answer written questions in a very limited area and he should never ever be interviewed. This is an abomination and violation--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And even it means a yearlong fight over executive privilege that battle should be waged?

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.sentences: My opinion the president should not sit down for an interview. He can answer written questions in a very limited area. Maybe 10, 12 questions.

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.sentences: What if is he subpoenaed -- what if he subpoenaed in front of grand jury? What would he do then?

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.sentences: I think what you do at that point is you have to argue article two. And if Bob Mueller wants to take the president of the United States who is not involved in any of the 19 charges that he has brought thus far, into a court over testimony, I think that that is -- would be one of the most disgraceful periods in American history. Absolutely outrageous.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You guys are amazing. I want you guys on every night. This is really important commentary. Thank you both.

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.sentences: And it's rare that Joe and I agree about anything.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I know.

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.sentences: Today we agree about on most things.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.sentences: Today it is a perfection. Today it's a perfection.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right, guys, thank you both. When we come back, Roseanne's ratings off the charts. So is it time for the media, Hollywood, to maybe look at their ongoing attacks against conservatives? Joe Concha, Larry Elder and more, we have a lot of news to break straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. The hit show Roseanne was back again last night. Look at this, over 15 million people tuning in. Maybe sex, violence and Jennifer Aniston falling in and out of love other things to do. Take a look.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: People parent differently than they did in your day. Turns out a lot of what you did not work and some of it was against the law.

utterances.speaker: ROSEANNE BARR
utterances.sentences: Yes, it's against the law because your generation made everything so P.C. instead of spanking them, you tell them to go over there and think about what they did wrong. You know what they're thinking? I can't believe this loser isn't spanking me.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You know, Roseanne's rating success could be a wake-up call for the liberal media and Hollywood. But something tells me they are too arrogant. They are too obsessed with hating Donald Trump. Now take a look at this latest cover from New York magazine that depicts the president as a pig. And by the way it doesn't stop there. On Monday night this is brutal. Liberal Jimmy Kimmel making fun of the first lady of the United States and her involvement in the White House Easter egg roll, even her accent. Jimmy, you are a despicable disgrace. Take a look.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: I want to really thank the first lady, Melania, who has done an incredible job. She worked so hard on this event and so I want to thank you. Yes, thank you.

utterances.speaker: JIMMY KIMMEL, COMEDIAN
utterances.sentences: Not a chance she did one thing to help set that up. No, she didn't dye eggs. She didn't fill that. Only thing she'd been working on is an escape tunnel. No White House Easter egg would be complete without story time from our first lady.

utterances.speaker: MELANIA TRUMP, FIRST LADY OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: Never stop exploring, because lives would be boring. Be clever and curious, just like a cat, ask lots of questions about this and that.

utterances.speaker: KIMMEL
utterances.sentences: About this and that. You realize what this means you could be first lady of the United States.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Ask clown Kimmel. Now I got to tell you something. What a disgrace. Hey, Mr. Kimmel, that's her fifth language. How many do you speak? Joining us now the Hill's Joe Concha, Salem nationally syndicated talk show host Larry Elder. Larry is smiling, Joe is smiling. I don't know who is smiling more. I'll be honest, leave the women and children alone. And they never -- Ivanka, Barron, Melania, stop at some point there's got to be an end to this.

utterances.speaker: JOE CONCHA, REPORTER AND COLUMNIST, THE HILL
utterances.sentences: First ladies rarely get attacked whether it be Michelle Obama, whether it be a Bush, whether it be- -

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Michelle Obama when she said for the first time in my adult life I'm proud of my country. She interjected herself into politics and that statement was outrageous.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.sentences: That's true. But overall, look, the favorability rating at Melania Trump is at 54 percent in Gallup. You want to attack her, roll the dice and take your chances. But there is no upside to this whatsoever.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I just find this part insulting, I mean, especially she is an extraordinarily bright woman. She is reading the children's book. It's something that first ladies do. Michelle Obama did it as well. And if you are not injecting yourself into politics, Larry, why? What's the point?

utterances.speaker: LARRY ELDER, SYNDICATED RADIO SHOW HOST
utterances.sentences: Well, I consider the Trump to be pretty tough people and Melania to be pretty tough as well. As you pointed out she speaks five languages. I'm pretty sure whatever Jimmy Kimmel said she is going to shine it on. But your bigger question is whether the Roseanne success is going to call Hollywood to rethink its assumptions towards conservatism and toward Donald Trump, hardly 90 percent of Hollywood's political money goes to the left. And you look at people like Steve Colbert, Sean, his numbers go up when he started attacking Donald Trump. When an A-list young actor--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I don't care what they say about Donald Trump. I think that's fair game. He is the president, fair game. You know, but if you go and really low and petty like that, I just -- I don't know. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.sentences: I think that this is nothing new. And I think that actually what we're seeing now is Donald Trump, the President, and Melania Trump, they are being made to being sympathetic figures. And then I look at the RCP average of polls, right? That's all the major polls.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Real Clear Politics.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.sentences: Right, Real Clear Politics.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: People don't know what RCP.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.sentences: I'm speaking jargon, right. Real Clear Politics, they take eight polls.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: RCP, all right, enough.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.sentences: Since December the president is up five points in that poll. And considering how polarized this country is and considering how overwhelming the media coverage is to jump five points over all those polls--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: That's big.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.sentences: -- that's pretty big.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: What do you think of Roseanne's success, Larry Elder?

utterances.speaker: ELDER
utterances.sentences: Well, it shows you that there is a market for people that don't get their point of view insulted. There is a whole market for people who want to turn on the television set. Just kick back, eat some popcorn, drink a beer and not have their views insulted. And that's what this show is showing. And Sean, the principal, one of the principal writers of this show is Wanda Sykes who is a Trump basher.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: ELDER
utterances.sentences: So I'm not even sure the show is that conservative. It's 'conservativish' that all people want. Just don't insult me. That's all I want. Don't demean me. That's all I need.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You know, so I this one movie project which I'm really proud of. 'Let There be Light.' It did extraordinarily well. We had no support of any studio. I can only imagine was a hit when that movie just came out.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: The movie poll just came out. It's like there is an opening here.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.sentences: An untapped audience, a niche audience called half the country? Yes, maybe.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.sentences: The numbers around Roseanne are remarkable to me. First of all, the second week it's done 15 million. All right. When you compare that to the Emmy Awards and that one trick pony that hosted it--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA

You know, everything -- he's doing what he can on his own. Why doesn't -- why don't the Republicans want to do these things?

utterances.speaker: JASON CHAFFETZ, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: Donald Trump wants to play offense. I can tell you, having left Congress about two weeks after, there is a whole new clarity that settles down on you. And until Republicans, who have been given the mantel of power, they were elected and put into office to get things done, until they actually play offense, guess what, they're just going to be on the receiving end of attacks.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: See, if they would too these simple things, if they would fully fund the border wall and begin the construction, the money is there -- and I still think the president can get it from the DOD. If they would repeal Obamacare, like they said they would, and the president has a great idea with the associations, why do I believe that's good politics and everybody is worried about the blue wave in 2018? That would mitigate the blue wave.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.utterance: Just do what you say you're going to do. If they would just do that, and do it in proactive way -- Jim Jordan talks a lot about this. This is what the American people elected us to do. So, let's try it and see what happens.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Let me ask -- this is how I see it. I see Hillary Clinton, she fixed the primary. Maybe I'm the only personal in the world that cares about Bernie Sanders supporters. That's kind of corrupt.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Then, Hillary Clinton, OK, she deletes 33,000 emails. She acid washes the hard drive. Bleach bit. Then she takes hammers or has people taking hammers and busting up these devices. Then, the fix is in with Strzok, Comey, Page, McCabe, and Loretta Lynch and the tarmac meeting. And they didn't interview -- writing an exoneration months before the investigation, they interview her. Two days later, they exonerate her.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And then you have the whole dossier and then you have lying to FISA court judges.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.utterance: And you have to understand that Director Comey went to President-elect Trump and said, hey, there is in dossier. It's unverified.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That in January of 2017.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.utterance: That's right. And so, hey, here's this bogus thing. Meanwhile, he had signed his name off --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Three months earlier.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.utterance: -- and presenting it to the court. So, why was it good enough to present to the court, but now that there is a President-elect Trump and a President Trump coming into office, suddenly, he is making excuses for it. That is something that both sides of the aisle should be looking at.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Is that a crime? In other words, I've got to believe that James Comey is in a heap of trouble between leaking this information that he had -- that was supposed to be confidential and privileged with the president. Then, of course, what he did with the special counsel appointed. Then, he's got this issue. Then, he's morphed into exonerate Hillary and he lays out 13.5 minute case and says never mind. I think he is in trouble legally. Do you?

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.utterance: Oh, I do think he is. Look, he had John Radcliffe in the House Judiciary Committee point blank, when did you make this decision, only to find out later, months later, the revelation that they started writing this exoneration months before Director Comey actually stood up in July of 2016 and said, you know, we don't find anything there there. I think he is in deep legal problems. That's why you need a second special counsel because the FBI cannot investigate itself.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Have you ever seen such corruption?

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.utterance: I haven't and it scares me, because it's at the highest levels. There is 110,000 people at the Department of Justice and they're good, hard working patriotic people.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: By the way, same with the FBI.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: This is not rank and file FBI or rank and file intelligence people.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.utterance: But you got the head of the beast here. And, you know, you look at those people in the senior most position. And that's different in electronic age now we have text messages and emails. Remember when the FBI said they couldn't find five months' worth with the inspector general --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: If I did what Hillary Clinton did with their emails --

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.utterance: Oh, you had handcuffs on, you'd be in jail.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You wouldn't be able to get me out.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.utterance: No, no.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Gee, thanks a lot. I'd take a cake with a file. But I look at all of this, did you ever heard of an FBI director taking a case away from a field office, putting it in a special category and writing an exoneration months before you investigate or talk to the key witnesses in the case?

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.utterance: And then you combine that with the people and what's going on with Robert Mueller now? One of the things I put on my list of 10 is that they should actually bring up and they should have Director Mueller and Rod Rosenstein testify before the House --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Do you think Rod Rosenstein belongs in his position?

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.utterance: I think he should be brought before Congress and he should have to testify about the conflicts of interest. And that would illuminate a whole set of problems.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. Great job to fill in for Laura. But I told you not to get -- Laura is back on Monday.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.utterance: She is. She's wonderful. She's one of the best.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I know. That was more for the liberal media. Congressman, good to see you.

utterances.speaker: CHAFFETZ
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I appreciate it.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. When we come back, you're definitely going to want to hear from U.S. Attorney Joe diGenova and esteemed legal scholar, Professor Alan Dershowitz. We have a lot of news we're getting to tonight right here on 'Hannity.' Stay with us.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Joining us now with more reaction to opening monologue, the author of the bestselling book, 'Trumped Up: How Criminalization and Political Differences Endangers Democracy', Professor Alan Dershowitz, and former U.S. attorney for the District of Columbia, Joe diGenova -- two of the smartest lawyers in the country. You know, last night, I got such incredible reaction to your comments. Collusion is not a crime. But we go from collusion to obstruction to then bank records. He is not a target. But the media is like, well, he's not a target but he's still in jeopardy. It's like there is no winning here.

utterances.speaker: ALAN DERSHOWITZ, HARVARD LAW SCHOOL PROFESSOR
utterances.utterance: I have to tell you, if after a year of very thorough investigation and going after all the low- hanging fruit and getting people not only to sing but some of them even perhaps to compose, if they couldn't have shifted him from a subject to a target, there's nothing there.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: What are they, hoping?

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.utterance: Of course, they are hoping. But I think they understand that. Now, they are going into very, very weak issues, collusion. I challenge Mueller to tell me what statute is violated by collusion. There's a memo now by Rosenstein authorizing him to investigate collusion with the Russians by Manafort. But you can't investigate sins. You can only investigate federal crimes. And there is no such federal crime collusion.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: How do they not know that?

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.utterance: They know it, but they hope that by investigating collusion, they'll get somebody to obstruct justice, to commit perjury, to commit one of these other peripheral crimes, as they always say it's in the cover-up. But it's not the cover-up. It's that prosecutors induce cover-ups, which is why innocent people shouldn't be testifying unless they absolutely have to because you can be indicted for perjury even if you tell the truth. If you say something that somebody else says differently.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That's a spectacular statement. You could be indicted for perjury even if you tell the truth.

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.utterance: That's right, because if somebody contradicts you, and the prosecutor believes the person contradicting you, you are indicted for perjury even though you told the truth.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I'm going to get back to that question in just a second. Let me go to Joe diGenova. Joe, Rod Rosenstein issues this letter to Mueller, allowing him to go after Paul Manafort the way he did, a week after they did the raid. Now, why do I think the order of that legally needs to be reversed?

utterances.speaker: JOE DIGENOVA, FORMER U.S. ATTORNEY
utterances.utterance: Well, let's say, this first of all, about Rod Rosenstein -- his conduct from the beginning of this has been a disgrace legally and every other way. He is an embarrassment to the administration. It is truly too bad that he cannot be fired. But let's be very clear about this. The president has never been a target. The fact that he has been recently notified that he is the subject means absolutely nothing. He is not even a subject. He is a witness. A subject is a person hesitate conduct is within the scope of the grand jury's investigation. What the hell does that mean? It means they don't have anything on him. There have been 19 criminal cases. Not one piece of evidence against the president of the United States. And now, we are told that Mueller wants to interview the president of the United States who knows nothing, who has been a witness to nothing, who is not a target of the investigation. What we are seeing now is conduct by two public officials, Robert Mueller and Rod Rosenstein that is unethical, unprofessional, an embarrassment to the United States government and is undermining equal enforcement of the law --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Oh, there's no doubt.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.utterance: -- because of what they are doing to a president of the United States. Rod Rosenstein single-handedly has taken away from the sitting president of the United States 16 months of his presidency by his incompetence and fearful conduct. You know why Rod Rosenstein appointed Mueller? Because he didn't want to make the tough decisions you would have to make if you were supervising a case being run by a United States attorney like Huber. Rod Rosenstein is a coward. He is a disgrace to the Department of Justice. It's a shame --

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And you can't fire him.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.utterance: -- that the president cannot fire him because of the political consequences.

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.utterance: They can't fire him, but it's amazing that he hasn't been recused. After all, he is the main witness --

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.utterance: Correct.

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.utterance: -- on whether or not collusion or whether or not -- I'm sorry, whether or not obstruction of justice occurred with the firing of Comey. And he wrote the memo.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: So doesn't the president have absolute right to fire anybody?

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.utterance: He does. But you know, politically there is a difference being have the right to do it and it being right to do it. I just want to comment on one thing that Joe has said. He is absolutely right that they have deprived the right of the president of the opportunity to govern but the Republicans did the same thing to Clinton. When they impeached him they knew they were never going to get him--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We still six years into his presidency.

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.utterance: Well, but still, they made a mistake and I think they paid a heavy consequence for it I think the Democrats would pay a heavy cost if they made the same mistake. Trying to impeach without being able to remove.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I want to ask--

utterances.speaker: JOE DIGENOVA, FORMER U.S. ATTORNEY FOR THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA
utterances.utterance: By the way, I want to say something about this notion that Mueller wants to question the president. What does he want to question him about?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. This is my question, though, Joe.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.utterance: First of all, he cannot question him about the firing of Comey. That is an article two constitutional authority.

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.utterance: Absolutely. I agree.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.utterance: That the president has to fire Comey. He had every right to fire Flynn. Suppose they say what were you thinking when you fired Comey? What were you thinking when you fired Flynn?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: What kind of question is that? Well, by the way--

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.utterance: These are the kind of stupid questions that could be asked.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Let me throw out this question to both of you and--

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.utterance: This is a perjury trap. Plain and simple.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I agree with the perjury.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.utterance: This is nonsense.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You're right.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.utterance: This is absolutely outrageous, it should end right now.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Here's the question I have, because I'm sure Robert Mueller does want to question the president. So, professor?

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I would advise him not to. I'm not -- I don't have your experience. But to me, it's a trap.

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.utterance: Here's the problem. Here's the problem.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.utterance: Written questions. Written questions.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Joe, one second. Hang on, professor.

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.utterance: Here's the problem. The special counsel has the power to put him in front of a grand jury without a lawyer. So he has some leverage. What I would suggest and the president should -- might consider this is if he is asked a question why did you fire Comey, his answer is you're not allowed to ask me or question any article 2 decision I make. Just like you can't question senators to their vote, you can't question justices for their vote. If I acted within the authority of article 2, I cannot be compelled or asked why I did something.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Would you advise this president to say no to any interview?

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.utterance: I'm not advising the president.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: No, you are not. Would you advise the president?

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.utterance: I would suggest that it would be best if the president refused to answer certain questions that intruded on his article two powers.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Last word, Joe, same question.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.utterance: The president should not agree to an interview in my opinion. And I'm not giving him legal advice. I'm talking on this show. The president should act the most answer written questions in a very limited area and he should never ever be interviewed. This is an abomination and violation--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And even it means a yearlong fight over executive privilege that battle should be waged?

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.utterance: My opinion the president should not sit down for an interview. He can answer written questions in a very limited area. Maybe 10, 12 questions.

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.utterance: What if is he subpoenaed -- what if he subpoenaed in front of grand jury? What would he do then?

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.utterance: I think what you do at that point is you have to argue article two. And if Bob Mueller wants to take the president of the United States who is not involved in any of the 19 charges that he has brought thus far, into a court over testimony, I think that that is -- would be one of the most disgraceful periods in American history. Absolutely outrageous.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You guys are amazing. I want you guys on every night. This is really important commentary. Thank you both.

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.utterance: And it's rare that Joe and I agree about anything.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I know.

utterances.speaker: DERSHOWITZ
utterances.utterance: Today we agree about on most things.

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.utterance: Today it is a perfection. Today it's a perfection.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right, guys, thank you both. When we come back, Roseanne's ratings off the charts. So is it time for the media, Hollywood, to maybe look at their ongoing attacks against conservatives? Joe Concha, Larry Elder and more, we have a lot of news to break straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. The hit show Roseanne was back again last night. Look at this, over 15 million people tuning in. Maybe sex, violence and Jennifer Aniston falling in and out of love other things to do. Take a look.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: People parent differently than they did in your day. Turns out a lot of what you did not work and some of it was against the law.

utterances.speaker: ROSEANNE BARR
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's against the law because your generation made everything so P.C. instead of spanking them, you tell them to go over there and think about what they did wrong. You know what they're thinking? I can't believe this loser isn't spanking me.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You know, Roseanne's rating success could be a wake-up call for the liberal media and Hollywood. But something tells me they are too arrogant. They are too obsessed with hating Donald Trump. Now take a look at this latest cover from New York magazine that depicts the president as a pig. And by the way it doesn't stop there. On Monday night this is brutal. Liberal Jimmy Kimmel making fun of the first lady of the United States and her involvement in the White House Easter egg roll, even her accent. Jimmy, you are a despicable disgrace. Take a look.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.utterance: I want to really thank the first lady, Melania, who has done an incredible job. She worked so hard on this event and so I want to thank you. Yes, thank you.

utterances.speaker: JIMMY KIMMEL, COMEDIAN
utterances.utterance: Not a chance she did one thing to help set that up. No, she didn't dye eggs. She didn't fill that. Only thing she'd been working on is an escape tunnel. No White House Easter egg would be complete without story time from our first lady.

utterances.speaker: MELANIA TRUMP, FIRST LADY OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.utterance: Never stop exploring, because lives would be boring. Be clever and curious, just like a cat, ask lots of questions about this and that.

utterances.speaker: KIMMEL
utterances.utterance: About this and that. You realize what this means you could be first lady of the United States.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Ask clown Kimmel. Now I got to tell you something. What a disgrace. Hey, Mr. Kimmel, that's her fifth language. How many do you speak? Joining us now the Hill's Joe Concha, Salem nationally syndicated talk show host Larry Elder. Larry is smiling, Joe is smiling. I don't know who is smiling more. I'll be honest, leave the women and children alone. And they never -- Ivanka, Barron, Melania, stop at some point there's got to be an end to this.

utterances.speaker: JOE CONCHA, REPORTER AND COLUMNIST, THE HILL
utterances.utterance: First ladies rarely get attacked whether it be Michelle Obama, whether it be a Bush, whether it be- -

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Michelle Obama when she said for the first time in my adult life I'm proud of my country. She interjected herself into politics and that statement was outrageous.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.utterance: That's true. But overall, look, the favorability rating at Melania Trump is at 54 percent in Gallup. You want to attack her, roll the dice and take your chances. But there is no upside to this whatsoever.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I just find this part insulting, I mean, especially she is an extraordinarily bright woman. She is reading the children's book. It's something that first ladies do. Michelle Obama did it as well. And if you are not injecting yourself into politics, Larry, why? What's the point?

utterances.speaker: LARRY ELDER, SYNDICATED RADIO SHOW HOST
utterances.utterance: Well, I consider the Trump to be pretty tough people and Melania to be pretty tough as well. As you pointed out she speaks five languages. I'm pretty sure whatever Jimmy Kimmel said she is going to shine it on. But your bigger question is whether the Roseanne success is going to call Hollywood to rethink its assumptions towards conservatism and toward Donald Trump, hardly 90 percent of Hollywood's political money goes to the left. And you look at people like Steve Colbert, Sean, his numbers go up when he started attacking Donald Trump. When an A-list young actor--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I don't care what they say about Donald Trump. I think that's fair game. He is the president, fair game. You know, but if you go and really low and petty like that, I just -- I don't know. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.utterance: I think that this is nothing new. And I think that actually what we're seeing now is Donald Trump, the President, and Melania Trump, they are being made to being sympathetic figures. And then I look at the RCP average of polls, right? That's all the major polls.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Real Clear Politics.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.utterance: Right, Real Clear Politics.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: People don't know what RCP.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.utterance: I'm speaking jargon, right. Real Clear Politics, they take eight polls.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: RCP, all right, enough.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.utterance: Since December the president is up five points in that poll. And considering how polarized this country is and considering how overwhelming the media coverage is to jump five points over all those polls--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That's big.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.utterance: -- that's pretty big.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: What do you think of Roseanne's success, Larry Elder?

utterances.speaker: ELDER
utterances.utterance: Well, it shows you that there is a market for people that don't get their point of view insulted. There is a whole market for people who want to turn on the television set. Just kick back, eat some popcorn, drink a beer and not have their views insulted. And that's what this show is showing. And Sean, the principal, one of the principal writers of this show is Wanda Sykes who is a Trump basher.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: ELDER
utterances.utterance: So I'm not even sure the show is that conservative. It's 'conservativish' that all people want. Just don't insult me. That's all I want. Don't demean me. That's all I need.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You know, so I this one movie project which I'm really proud of. 'Let There be Light.' It did extraordinarily well. We had no support of any studio. I can only imagine was a hit when that movie just came out.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: The movie poll just came out. It's like there is an opening here.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.utterance: An untapped audience, a niche audience called half the country? Yes, maybe.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.utterance: The numbers around Roseanne are remarkable to me. First of all, the second week it's done 15 million. All right. When you compare that to the Emmy Awards and that one trick pony that hosted it--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.utterance: -- Stephen Colbert it only did 12. So it's doing better than the Emmys, it's almost as many as the Oscars in week one. Now listen to this though, this is where it gets really good. All right. In Tulsa, Cincinnati and Kansas City, those were the top three cities for Roseanne's opening week. In New York, it didn't even finish in the top 20. Los Angeles not even the top 30.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: By the way, if you want to--

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.utterance: Talk about a divide.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You want to test market something. Go to those markets in San Diego.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.utterance: In San Diego of all places.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.utterance: Of all places. Well--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You guys are amazing.

utterances.speaker: CONCHA
utterances.utterance: Good to see you.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Good to see you. Larry, thank you as always, sir. Coming up, Hillary Clinton's list of things for her to blame her election loss on. It got longer. I'm not making this up. We will tell you who she is blaming straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. Hillary Clinton, she just can't control herself. And I kid you not. Hillary Clinton complaining yet again about losing to Donald Trump. Here is what she said last night during an event in New York City.

utterances.speaker: HILLARY CLINTON, D, FORMER UNITED STATES PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: Every day that goes by, more evidence, more proof about, you know, fake news and the Russians and Cambridge Analytica and, you know, misogyny and sexism. I mean, it's hard. It's very hard. You know, I have taken on the NRA for years. And they spend more money against me than they have ever spent against anybody. We'll find out whether any of that was Russian money.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: NRA the latest to join Hillary Clinton's list. There it is growing list of culprits that are responsible for her loss to Donald Trump. But that wasn't the only controversial thing that Hillary said last night. She took a shot at Fox News. I'm shocked. Take a look.

utterances.speaker: CLINTON
utterances.utterance: Fox news is always trying to impeach me. So somebody needs to tell them it doesn't apply a private citizen.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: The dog bites, the besting, if you are feeling sad it's Fox News' fault. Joining us now, national security strategist, Dr. Sebastian Gorka and Catalina magazine publisher Cathy Areu. Why can't she just say I lost? Why does she have to become unhinged. She lost. She was a horrible candidate with a horrible message coming off eight horrible years of Obama.

utterances.speaker: CATHY AREU, PUBLISHER, CATALINA MAGAZINE
utterances.utterance: She didn't lose. She won by three million votes.

utterances.speaker: SEBASTIAN GORKA, NATIONAL SECURITY STRATEGIST, FOX NEWS
utterances.utterance: Not in America.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: What's that, Dr. Gorka?

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: Not in the American system.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GORKA
utterances.utterance: We have an Electoral College, my dear.

utterances.speaker: AREU
utterances.utterance: Which, I mean, Donald Trump himself was against Electoral College. He thought it was silly system and should not be in place until it worked in his favor and then it's a wonderful system.
